019package org.jgrapes.core.internal;
020
021import java.util.ArrayDeque;
022import java.util.HashSet;
023import java.util.Iterator;
024import java.util.Queue;
025import java.util.Set;
026import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedDeque;
027import java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService;
028import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
029import org.jgrapes.core.Components;
030import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
031import org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline;
032
033/**
034 * This class provides the default implementation of an {@link EventPipeline}.
035 */
036@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
037public class EventProcessor implements InternalEventPipeline, Runnable {
038
039    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.FieldNamingConventions")
040    protected static final ThreadLocal<EventBase<?>> newEventsParent
041        = new ThreadLocal<>();
042
043    private final ExecutorService executorService;
044    private final ComponentTree componentTree;
045    private final EventPipeline asEventPipeline;
046    protected final Queue<EventChannelsTuple> queue = new ArrayDeque<>();
047    private Iterator<HandlerReference> invoking;
048    // Used by this thread only.
049    private final Set<EventBase<?>> suspended = new HashSet<>();
050    // Only this thread can remove, but others might add.
051    private final Queue<EventBase<?>> toBeResumed
052        = new ConcurrentLinkedDeque<>();
053    private boolean isExecuting;
054    private final ThreadLocal<Thread> executor = new ThreadLocal<>();
055
056    /**
057     * Instantiates a new event processor.
058     *
059     * @param tree the tree
060     */
061    /* default */ EventProcessor(ComponentTree tree) {
062        this(tree, Components.defaultExecutorService());
063    }
064
065    /* default */ EventProcessor(ComponentTree tree,
066            ExecutorService executorService) {
067        this.componentTree = tree;
068        this.executorService = executorService;
069        asEventPipeline = new CheckingPipelineFilter(tree, this);
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Gets the component tree.
074     *
075     * @return the component tree
076     */
077    protected ComponentTree tree() {
078        return componentTree;
079    }
080
081    /* default */ EventPipeline asEventPipeline() {
082        return asEventPipeline;
083    }
084
085    /**
086     * Called before adding completion events. The parent of
087     * a completion event is not the event that has completed but
088     * the event that generated the original event.
089     *
090     * @param parent the new parent
091     */
092    /* default */ void updateNewEventsParent(EventBase<?> parent) {
093        newEventsParent.set(parent);
094    }
095
096    @Override
097    public <T extends Event<?>> T add(T event, Channel... channels) {
098        ((EventBase<?>) event).generatedBy(newEventsParent.get());
099        ((EventBase<?>) event).processedBy(this);
100        synchronized (this) {
101            EventChannelsTuple.addTo(queue, event, channels);
102            if (!isExecuting) {
103                // Queue was initially empty, this starts it
104                GeneratorRegistry.instance().add(this);
105                isExecuting = true;
106                executorService.execute(this);
107            }
108        }
109        return event;
110    }
111
112    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ConfusingTernary")
113    /* default */ void add(Queue<EventChannelsTuple> source) {
114        synchronized (this) {
115            while (true) {
116                EventChannelsTuple entry = source.poll();
117                if (entry == null) {
118                    break;
119                }
120                entry.event.processedBy(this);
121                queue.add(entry);
122            }
123            if (!isExecuting) {
124                GeneratorRegistry.instance().add(this);
125                isExecuting = true;
126                executorService.execute(this);
127            }
128        }
129    }
130
131    @Override
132    public void merge(InternalEventPipeline other) {
133        if (!(other instanceof BufferingEventPipeline)) {
134            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
135                "Can only merge events from an BufferingEventPipeline.");
136        }
137        add(((BufferingEventPipeline) other).retrieveEvents());
138    }
139
140    @Override
141    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidDeeplyNestedIfStmts",
142        "PMD.CognitiveComplexity" })
143    public void run() {
144        String origName = Thread.currentThread().getName();
145        try {
146            Thread.currentThread().setName(
147                origName + " (P" + Components.objectId(this) + ")");
148            executor.set(Thread.currentThread());
149            componentTree.setDispatchingPipeline(this);
150            while (true) {
151                // No lock needed, only this thread can remove from resumed
152                var resumedEvent = toBeResumed.poll();
153                if (resumedEvent != null) {
154                    if (suspended.remove(resumedEvent)) {
155                        resumedEvent.invokeWhenResumed();
156                        invokeHandlers(resumedEvent.clearSuspendedHandlers(),
157                            resumedEvent);
158                    }
159                    continue;
160                }
161
162                EventChannelsTuple next;
163                synchronized (this) {
164                    next = queue.poll();
165                    if (next == null) {
166                        // Everything is done, though suspended handlers
167                        // may cause this processor to be reactivated.
168                        GeneratorRegistry.instance().remove(this);
169                        isExecuting = false;
170                        synchronized (executor) {
171                            executor.notifyAll();
172                        }
173                        break;
174                    }
175                }
176                HandlerList handlers
177                    = componentTree.getEventHandlers(next.event, next.channels);
178                invokeHandlers(handlers.iterator(), next.event);
179            }
180        } finally {
181            // This processor should now only be (strongly) referenced
182            // from suspended events (if any exist), the
183            // CheckingPipelineFilter (which is only referenced from this)
184            // and some component tree, if this is the tree's default
185            // processor.
186            newEventsParent.set(null);
187            componentTree.setDispatchingPipeline(null);
188            executor.set(null);
189            Thread.currentThread().setName(origName);
190        }
191    }
192
193    /**
194     * Invoke all (remaining) handlers with the given event as parameter.
195     *
196     * @param handlers the handlers
197     * @param event the event
198     */
199    private void invokeHandlers(Iterator<HandlerReference> handlers,
200            EventBase<?> event) {
201        try {
202            invoking = handlers;
203            newEventsParent.set(event);
204            // invoking may be set to null by suspendHandling()
205            while (invoking != null && invoking.hasNext()) {
206                HandlerReference hdlr = invoking.next();
207                try {
208                    if (event.isStopped()) {
209                        break;
210                    }
211                    hdlr.invoke(event);
212                } catch (AssertionError t) {
213                    // JUnit support
214                    CoreUtils.setAssertionError(t);
215                    event.handlingError(asEventPipeline, t);
216                } catch (Error e) { // NOPMD
217                    // Wouldn't have caught it, if it was possible.
218                    throw e;
219                } catch (Throwable t) { // NOPMD
220                    // Errors have been rethrown, so this should work.
221                    event.handlingError(asEventPipeline, t);
222                }
223            }
224        } catch (AssertionError t) {
225            // JUnit support
226            CoreUtils.setAssertionError(t);
227            event.handlingError(asEventPipeline, t);
228        } catch (Error e) { // NOPMD
229            // Wouldn't have caught it, if it was possible.
230            throw e;
231        } catch (Throwable t) { // NOPMD
232            // Errors have been rethrown, so this should work.
233            event.handlingError(asEventPipeline, t);
234        } finally { // NOPMD
235            if (invoking != null) {
236                event.handled();
237                invoking = null;
238                newEventsParent.get().decrementOpen();
239            }
240        }
241    }
242
243    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CompareObjectsWithEquals")
244    /* default */ void suspendHandling(EventBase<?> event) {
245        if (Thread.currentThread() != executor.get()) {
246            throw new IllegalStateException("May only be called from handler.");
247        }
248        if (!invoking.hasNext()) {
249            // Last anyway, nothing to be done
250            return;
251        }
252        event.setSuspendedHandlers(invoking);
253        invoking = null;
254        suspended.add(event);
255        // Just in case (might happen)
256        toBeResumed.remove(event);
257    }
258
259    /* default */ void resumeHandling(EventBase<?> event) {
260        toBeResumed.add(event);
261        synchronized (this) {
262            if (!isExecuting) {
263                // There were no more events, restart
264                GeneratorRegistry.instance().add(this);
265                isExecuting = true;
266                executorService.execute(this);
267            }
268        }
269    }
270
271    /*
272     * (non-Javadoc)
273     * 
274     * @see org.jgrapes.core.internal.InternalEventPipeline#executorService()
275     */
276    @Override
277    public ExecutorService executorService() {
278        return executorService;
279    }
280
281    @Override
282    public void awaitExhaustion() throws InterruptedException {
283        synchronized (executor) {
284            while (isExecuting) {
285                executor.wait();
286            }
287        }
288    }
289
290    /*
291     * (non-Javadoc)
292     * 
293     * @see java.lang.Object#toString()
294     */
295    @Override
296    public String toString() {
297        StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
298        builder.append(Components.objectName(this))
299            .append(" [");
300        if (queue != null) {
301            builder.append("queue=")
302                .append(queue);
303        }
304        builder.append(']');
305        return builder.toString();
306    }
307
308}
